title: Man dies after being hit by bus carrying children to school
text:

A man has died after being hit by a bus taking children to school.

The man was hit just after 8am today on Lord Street, a main road through Southport town centre, close to the town hall.

Around a dozen police cars, plus fire engines and ambulances, surrounded the scene as shocked locals looked on.

Police investigators were seen entering the vehicle to take photographs and, according to one resident, a number of schoolchildren who were on the bus spoke with officers after the crash.

Emergency services attended and Lord Street is set to remain closed throughout the day as investigations continue, reports the Liverpool Echo .

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

Confirming the tragic news a Merseyside Police spokesman said: "We are appealing for information following a fatal collision in Southport this morning.

"A report was received shortly after 8.10am that a collision involving a bus and a male pedestrian had happened on Lord Street.

"Police, Merseyside Fire and Rescue Service and the North West Ambulance Service attended and the man was sadly pronounced dead at the scene."

Efforts are ongoing to identify the man and inform his next of kin.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

A section of Lord Street is closed in both directions from its junction with Eastbank Street to the fire station roundabout.

ECHO reporter Jamie Lopez said: "There's a heavy police presence here, including a van marked ‘vehicle investigation unit’.

"According to one local, a number of schoolchildren were on the bus and have spoken to police."

One resident added: "I feel sorry for all the school kids that were on the bus."

Anyone with information is asked to contact Merseyside Police social media desk via Twitter @MerPolCC or Facebook Merseyside Police CC. You can also call 101 quoting incident reference 199 of 21 October.
